data.title: Landmark bronze statues that are worth a look in Pasadena.
data.text: These 9 ft high bronze sculptures of the heads of Jackie and Mack Robinson, campaigners for civil justice, are real landmarks as they look towards the magnificent Pasadena City Hall... Certainly worth a look.

data.title: Jackie and Mack Robinson
data.text: Located across from Pasadena City Hall at Centennial Square.  Take in the view from afar and enjoy getting closer.  They are grand.  then you must see and touch these bronze likenesses cole up.  Various texts and images are embedded in their hair.  You get to know really each one as you explore contributions to the community, to sports and politics.  Full lives lived!

data.title: Robinson Memorial
data.text: A well thought of tribute by Pasadena to baseball legend Jackie Robinson & his brother, track great Mack Robinson across from historic City Hall.  A must see for historic & cultural enthusiasts.  Also there is a cultural center/library named for Jackie in town with an exhibit detailing how he broke the color barrier in baseball, although it is located north of the memorial.

data.title: Excellent homage to Jackie and Mack Robinson
data.text:
The monument that honors Jackie Robinson and his brother Mack Robinson, is located across the parking lot right in front of the City of Pasadena City Hall building.  The statues are busts that are 9 ft x 6 ft x 7 ft and weight about 2700 lbs each. The memorial was dedicated on November 6, 1997. The Jackie Robinson bust has engravings that are barely visible that tell short stories about the impact he had in his community, not just baseball. The sculpture also has images engraved on the back of his head. 

The Mack Robinson bust is also sculpted in the same manner with descriptive texts and images on the back of his head. Since Mack never left Pasadena, he is facing City Hall. Jackie left for Brooklyn so he faces east towards Brooklyn. The landscape around the monuments was completed on June 20, 2002 with benches and peach tress to honor their birthplace of Cairo, Georgia. This area lends itself to anyone who wants to sit and reflect or ponder. 

The area is beautiful and so peaceful. The City Hall building in front of the monument is gorgeous and looks very old. A lot of people take wedding pictures here. The area is clean and organized, perfect for a family outing.
